articles.author: Erin Banco, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Trump and his envoy for Ukraine and Russia, Keith Kellogg, have both said they are working on a plan to broker a deal to end the war but have offered few details about their strategy or when they might unveil such a plan.
articles.title: Exclusive: U.S. wants Ukraine to hold elections following a ceasefire, says Trump envoy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas is expected to hand over three Israelis on Saturday, in the latest stage of a gradual exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners under a truce aimed at opening the way to ending the 15-month war in Gaza.
articles.title: Three Israeli hostages set to be released in latest Gaza exchange

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones and missiles on Ukraine on Saturday, killing at least three civilians and damaging residential buildings and infrastructure, officials said.
articles.title: Russian air attack kills three in Ukraine, Kyiv says

articles.author: David Shepardson, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Investigators plan to push forward on Friday with efforts to retrieve the two aircraft involved in a crash in Washington that killed 67 people and raised questions about air safety in the U.S. capital.
articles.title: Investigators seek to salvage aircraft after deadly Washington crash

articles.author: David Lawder, Andrea Shalal, Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is expected to sign an order on Saturday imposing hefty new tariffs of 25% on goods from Mexico and Canada and 10% on imports from China, potentially disrupting more than $2.1 trillion worth of annual trade.
articles.title: Trump readies order for steep tariffs on goods from Mexico, Canada, China

articles.author: Shivangi Acharya
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi faces the challenges of reviving growth and giving relief to a middle class hit by rising living costs, while also preparing for an uncertain year of global trade, when his government unveils its budget on Saturday.
articles.title: India's Modi to seek to boost growth, ease cost of living in budget

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: A medevac plane crashed soon after takeoff in Philadelphia on Friday with a child and five others on board, the air ambulance company that operated it said, adding that it had not confirmed any survivors.
articles.title: Small medevac plane crashes in Philadelphia with child, 5 others on board

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A major offensive by Rwandan-backed M23 rebels in east Democratic Republic of Congo appeared to have stalled on Saturday after the army took back some ground, two civil society sources and a local official said.
articles.title: Fighting stalls in east Congo as troops push back Rwanda-backed rebels

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni said on Saturday his government would continue to prosecute civilians in military tribunals even after the country's top court banned the practice, ruling it unconstitutional.
articles.title: Ugandan leader pledges to continue using military courts despite ban

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The Black Hawk helicopter that collided with a passenger jet in Washington on Wednesday was on a training flight along a route core to a seldom-discussed military mission to evacuate senior officials to safety in the event of an attack on the U.S., officials say.
articles.title: Crashed US Army Black Hawk unit was responsible for doomsday readiness
